trans-unit.source: Provides a way to arrange content in a grid where all the cells in the grid have the same size.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid"></xref> class.
Defines the layout of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid"></xref> by distributing space evenly among all of the child elements.
The `arrangeSize` parameter defines the space in the layout area that is available for the grid.
For example, if there are two rows and four columns in a grid, the possible height for each cell is 0.5\**arrangeSizeHeight* and the maximum width is 0.25**arrangeSizeWidth*.

For these calculations, *arrangeSizeHeight* is the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> value of the `arrangeSize` parameter and *arrangeSizeWidth* is the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> value of the `arrangeSize` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the area for the grid to use.
The actual <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the grid that is rendered to display the child elements that are visible.
Gets or sets the number of columns that are in the grid.

A value of zero (0) for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns%2A> property specifies that the column count is computed based on the number of rows and the number of visible child elements that are in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Grid>.

The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.FirstColumn%2A> must be less than the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns%2A> property for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid> to work correctly.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The number of columns that are in the grid.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the number of leading blank cells in the first row of the grid.

The value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.FirstColumn%2A> must be less than the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Columns%2A> property for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid> to work correctly.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The number of empty cells that are in the first row of the grid.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.FirstColumn"></xref> dependency property.
Computes the desired size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid"></xref> by measuring all of the child elements.
The `constraint` parameter defines the maximum amount of space that is available for the grid.
This space is divided up equally based on the number of rows and columns in the grid.
The size of each child is measured to determine the maximum width of all the child elements of the grid.
The maximum values cannot exceed the maximum cell size that is computed from the `constraint`.
A desired grid <xref:System.Windows.Size> is computed based on the maximum child dimensions.
The <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> is the maximum child width multiplied by the number of columns.
The <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> is the maximum child height multiplied by the number of rows.
This method returns the desired <xref:System.Windows.Size>.
For example, if there are two rows and four columns in a grid, the maximum height for each cell is 0.5\**constraintHeight* and the maximum width is 0.25**constraintWidth*.

For these calculations, *constraintHeight* is the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Height%2A> value of the `constraint` parameter and *constraintWidth* is the <xref:System.Windows.Size.Width%2A> value of the `constraint` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Size"></xref> of the available area for the grid.
The desired based on the child content of the grid and the constraint parameter.
Gets or sets the number of rows that are in the grid.

A value of zero (0) for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Rows%2A> property specifies that the row count is computed based on the number of columns and the number of visible child elements that are in the grid.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The number of rows that are in the grid.
The default is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.UniformGrid.Rows"></xref> dependency property.
